title: Suggestion: opt-in moderation review before a post goes public
body: I am unable to reliably determine what content the mods do and do not allow on the Boards. I would like it if I could have my posts initially hidden by default until mods review my content and approve acceptable posts. I'd rather have my posts delayed by a few days than learn that one of my posts has so horribly offended someone that it had to be deleted, or wait three hours in Discord to ask a mod if my intended post will be acceptable (which I have done).

replies.body: Frankly, the tech isn't there (it's everyone or no one for review-required posting) and the team isn't big enough even if it were. We're always happy to answer questions about any actions or removals though.

Unfortunately we don't have a great system for this *or* the team size to handle it, unless you're willing to just wait in the Discord.

>...but also because my last removal sounded like a definite warning, and I don't want to "oops" my way to a permaban.

If you're referring to the comment *"I'd like to emphasize that this is not a warning; however, please take some time to familiarize yourself with the Boards Universal Rules, as well as the guidelines for any sub-board you intend to post in before you do so*", that's not a warning, as it clearly stated. It is, however, our standard non-warning response, as usually these removals are tied to borderline behavior or getting sucked into a heated debate with someone who *is* violating the rules, which we also recommend against in most cases.

In short, it really is just a heads up that something was removed, and a reminder that the rules exist. That's all.

>
> Only post in Gameplay+, problem solved! :P

That only applies to creating threads, and [good luck](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/general-discussion/BE5UEWi5-gameplay-needs-better-moderation-of-new-threads) understanding why your thread was rejected, if you actually care about posting it. And yet I would prefer such a system if it meant not having to deal with a mod scolding me every few weeks.

I don't think it is possible for posts to be delayed for specific users, although I could be wrong on this. ~~The problem with this is that there would be delays with posts making it to the Boards. Although it may not affect you, this could affect others wanting immediate feedback. There are exceptions to this of course (Gameplay+).~~ Generally, if your post does not break any of the [Universal Rules](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/community-moderation/ITFIpNUE), it should be fine.

If a post seems to tip between breaking the rules and not, they are brought up with other Moderators/Board-Specific Specialists before being potentially removed. Moderators should not be removing posts because **they** are offended, it should only happen if you broke a specific rule listed in the rulebook.

> [{quoted}](name=HeyItzSteve,realm=NA,application-id=6heBIhQc,discussion-id=5EMqL6eX,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2019-01-16T02:59:42.252+0000)

Moderators should not be removing posts because **they** are offended, it should only happen if you broke a specific rule listed in the rulebook.

It would be nice if that were the case, but it isn't. My last two mod deletions were for quoting someone else's deleted post (I was assured that it was **not** a warning, but then immediately told to read the rules) and for an "inflammatory" analogy (I got a copypasta caution against discussing religion/sex/politics/social issues, which I hadn't, and was then warned that if I keep breaking the rules I'll be punished) which apparently "end up derailing, leading to arguments and insults" even though my post was followed by no such things.

I just want the mods to help me follow the rules instead of standing there with a rolled-up newspaper and waiting for me to fail, which will inevitably happen.

> [{quoted}](name=HeyItzSteve,realm=NA,application-id=6heBIhQc,discussion-id=5EMqL6eX,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2019-01-16T02:59:42.252+0000)
>
> The problem with this is that there would be massive delays with posts making it to the Boards. Although it may not affect you, this could affect others wanting immediate feedback. There are exceptions to this of course (Gameplay+). Generally, if your post does not break any of the [Universal Rules](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/community-moderation/ITFIpNUE), it should be fine.

That is why I said "opt-in."

The Universal Rules aren't an exhaustive list that a mod can point to and say "see, you violated that right there." The following paragraph basically says that inappropriate discussion topics are not appropriate:

> Inappropriate discussion topics may be subject to escalated punishments, depending on the content in question.

It doesn't explicitly refer to the paragraph above it, which gives some examples of inappropriate posts. It stands on its own. If a mod thinks something is inappropriate, it's against the rules, plain and simple. And I'm okay with that being a rule! But, since I'm not a mod, I cannot determine what's appropriate, and we don't have enough tools to reliably determine what a mod would think of any given post (clear rules). Therefore, the mods should take on an active role in ensuring appropriate posts - _before_ we post something inappropriate. I _want_ to follow the rules. As a programmer, I'm _good_ at following rules, and even figuring out unwritten rules from time to time. However, the documentation on these rules is too sparse, and the error messages are unhelpful (basically "your post was bad and you should feel bad; go read these unhelpful rules").
